definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Reading these same stories mythologically, however, can bring forth their universal qualities.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这些相同的神话故事也展示了他们的普遍特征。

sentences.english: Mythology adds a richness of detail and a concreteness to metaphorical language.
sentences.chinese: 神话故事增加了大量的细节描述和一个寓意。
小孩贪婪地倾听神话故事。

sentences.english: What he said sounded like a fairy-tale.
sentences.chinese: 他所说的话听起来就像神话故事。

sentences.english: It does not draw from real life, it only creates myths.
A nurse’s fairy-tales are accepted as the gospel truth.
sentences.chinese: 保姆的神话故事被当作福音书中的真理而接受。

sentences.english: Old Mrs. Mingott's foreign daughters had become a legend.
sentences.chinese: 老明戈特太太的两个外籍女儿成了一则神话故事。

sentences.english: MAGIC】In fairy tales witches often use magic to change persons into animals or birds.
sentences.chinese: 在神话故事中，巫婆常使用魔术将人变成动物或鸟。

sentences.english: Legend of the White Snake is one of the most famous tales spreading out among folks in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 白蛇传是流传在古代中国非常著名的一个神话故事。

sentences.english: The teacher regaled the children with some fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 老师讲了些神话故事，孩子们听得津津有味。

sentences.english: The legend Chang Er Flying to the Moon is a beautiful fable of ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥奔月的传说是中国古代一个美丽的神话故事。

sentences.english: In Chapter Two, regenerationout of death is strongly implied through the religious and mythical stories embedded in the poem.
sentences.chinese: 第二章从诗歌贯穿始终的宗教和神话故事角度分析。

sentences.english: He depicted traditional Chinese folk tales or historical stories to hint obliquely at contemporary realist themes.
sentences.chinese: 都是以历史或神话故事影射现实的主题性创作。

sentences.english: Then put it like fairy tales, one angel, one demon.
sentences.chinese: 那么就像神话故事中所言，一是天使，一是魔鬼。

definition: legend/folklore/to repeat from mouth to mouth/they say that...
Classic of Mountain and Sea, probably compiled c. 500 BC-200 BC, contains wide range of geography, mythology, witchcraft, popular customs etc

Investiture of the Gods, major Ming dynasty vernacular novel of mythology and fantasy, very loosely based on King Wu of Zhou's 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrow of the Shang, subsequent material for opera, film, TV series, computer games etc
supernatural novel/novel of ghosts and goblins
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio, Qing dynasty book of tales by 蒲松齡|蒲松龄[Pu2 Song1 ling2]
Journey to the West, Ming dynasty novel by Wu Cheng'en 吳承恩|吴承恩, one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/also called Pilgrimage to the West or Monkey
lit. mythical bird Jingwei tries to fill the ocean with stones (idiom); futile ambition/task of Sisyphus/determination in the face of impossible odds
In Search of the Supernatural, compilation of legends about spirits, ghosts and other supernatural phenomena, written and compiled by 干寶|干宝[Gan1 Bao3] in Jin dynasty
